Class FESI.Interpreter.LocalClassLoader 

FESI.Interpreter.LocalClassLoader
public class LocalClassLoader
This code is largely inspired of Java Examples in a Nutshell. The loaders are shared by all instance of the evaluator, they are therefore synchronized when needed.

Throws: ClassNotFoundException
If class cannot be loaded
loadClass 
 public Class loadClass(String classname,
                        boolean resolve) throws ClassNotFoundException
This is one abstract method of ClassLoader that all subclasses must define. Its job is to load an array of bytes from somewhere and to pass them to defineClass(). If the resolve argument is true, it must also call resolveClass(), which will do things like verify the presence of the superclass. Because of this second step, this method may be called to load superclasses that are system classes, and it must take this into account.

Parameters:
classname - The name of the class to load
resolve - True if class must be resolved
Returns:
the loaded class
Throws: ClassNotFoundException
If class cannot be loaded
